TACKLING.Definition: dealing with or addressing (a difficult or challenging subject)

JOSTLING.Definition: pushing others in a competitive situation to gain advantage

CONVENIENCE.Definition: something that was useful or suitable for a particular purpose

MENTAL BREAKDOWNS.Definition: instances of severe mental distress or inability to function normally

TREASON.Definition: disloyalty or betrayal of one's country

SLAUGHTERED.Definition: killed in a violent or brutal manner

PUT INTO MOTION.Definition: set in action or cause to start

THE SEEDS HAD ALREADY BEEN SOWN.Definition: the initial causes or factors of the situation were already present

FORESIGHT.Definition: ability to predict or plan for the future

PROTRACTED.Definition: extended or prolonged in time, drawn-out

ASSERT.Definition: state or declare positively and forcefully

CLAIMANTS.Definition: people making a formal demand for it

VASTLY.Definition: to a very great extent or degree

PEASANT.Definition: a poor farmer or agricultural worker

MENTAL BREAKDOWN.Definition: an instance of severe mental distress or inability to function normally

PROTECTOR.Definition: someone chosen to guard or defend

CAME TO HIS SENSES.Definition: regained normal mental clarity or awareness

PUSHED ASIDE.Definition: moved out of a position of importance or influence

RIVAL.Definition: competitor, opponent or compete with, match

MENTALLY UNFIT.Definition: unable to perform normal mental tasks or duties

BY SOME MEASURES.Definition: according to certain criteria or standards

SIDELINING.Definition: removing from a position of prominence or influence

ON BEHALF OF.Definition: acting in the interest or for the benefit of him

QUASHED.Definition: suppressed or put an end to forcefully

LORD PROTECTOR.Definition: a high-ranking official chosen to govern and protect the state in place of its monarch

PIKE.Definition: a long spear or weapon with a pointed metal head

FORMIDABLE.Definition: inspiring fear or respect through being impressively powerful or capable

THE TIDE WAS TURNING.Definition: the situation was beginning to change in a significant way

COMMONER.Definition: a person who was not of noble rank or title

TAKE THIS SITTING DOWN.Definition: accept it without resistance or protest

THE BALL WAS BACK IN THE COURT.Definition: the situation had returned to their responsibility

INTERCEPT.Definition: stop or catch her before she reached her destination

SEIZE.Definition: take hold of suddenly and forcibly

NEPHEWS.Definition: the male children of his brother

WHISTLESTOP TOUR.Definition: quick and brief overview or summary

KEEP UP WITH.Definition: stay informed or maintain pace with

TAKE MY HAT OFF TO YOU.Definition: express admiration or respect for your achievement or effort
